key_points: Tiger Woods experienced a turbulent year in 2021, highlighted by a serious car accident on February 23 near Rancho Palo Verdes, Southern California.
The accident presented a life-threatening situation for Woods, differing significantly from his past controversies and mishaps.
The golf community, including fellow golfers like Justin Thomas and Adam Scott, responded with sympathy and respect to Woods' accident.
Despite questions about the accident and potential special treatment by law enforcement, the golf world showed a willingness to move on.
Tiger Woods was absent from the golf scene for most of the year, with updates on his condition coming from friends rather than official statements.
Rory McIlroy visited Woods before the Masters and found him in better condition than expected, given the severity of the crash.
In late November, Woods shared a video update showing him hitting golf shots, signaling his recovery progress.
Woods made a return to golf at the PNC Championship in Florida, playing alongside his son and showing promising performance.
The golf world reacted with excitement to Woods' return and speculated on his future in professional golf.
The year highlighted reflections on Tiger Woods' impact on golf and his fortunate survival, generating gratitude and anticipation for his future in the sport.
